page.title: 14BIRDS IN TIBBERTON-EDGMOND
page.content: The{Tawny Owl}is around in March and can be recognised by its ho-hoo sound in the dark. It has a brown face, black eyes, dark brown underparts and no ear tufts. The{Adult Swan}is distinguished by an orange beak with a black basal knob. It curves its neck when at rest. The Swans can be seen in April on rivers and ponds. The{Robin}is easily noticed in December-February with its red chest and face. It has three calls, the commonest being "Tic-Tic." The{Kingfisher}is one of the most brilliantly-coloured birds of the region with a blue-green top and a chestnut red front. Its call is the "Cheee" or "Chikee. "The Kingfisher is found by streams.
